sen.j: 善正寺は、豊臣秀吉の実姉とも（智）が豊臣秀次の菩提を弔うため、慶長2年（1597年）に嵯峨の亀山に庵を結んだことに始まる。
sen.e: Zensho-ji Temple began with a thatched hut that was built in 1597 in Kameyama, Saga by Hideyoshi's elder sister Tomo to pray for the soul of Hidetsugu TOYOTOMI.

sen.j: 秀次は秀吉の養子になり関白にもなったが、秀吉に実子豊臣秀頼が生まれると疎まれるようになり、ついには切腹を命じられ、秀次の妻妾も三条河原でことごとく処刑された。
sen.e: Hidetsugu became the adopted son of Hideyoshi and also became kanpaku (advisor to the emperor) but the relationship between Hidetsugu and Hideyoshi began to deteriorate after his son Hideyori TOYOTOMI was born, and he was ordered to commit seppuku while his wife and mistresses were executed beside Sanjo-gawa River.

sen.j: この事件の後、ともは出家して日秀と名乗り、現在の地に堂宇を建立した。
sen.e: Following this incident, Tomo became a Buddhist nun, took the name Nisshu and established a Buddhist hall on the site of the present Zensho-ji Temple.

sen.e: Zuiryu-ji Temple in modern-day Omihachiman City, Shiga Prefecture (Omihachiman City) was dedicated by Nisshu to pray for her own soul following her death.
